AvProblem.comment: distant from ridges, behind discontinuities, in gullies, steep bowls in all aspects

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Fresh snowdrifts generated by foehn wind
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger above 2000 m is moderate, below that altitude danger is low. Fresh snowdrift accumulations can trigger by 1 person above 2000 m on steep shady slopes, releases often medium-sized. Danger zones will increase with ascending altitude, also distant from ridges, in steep gullies and bowls and behind discontinuities on W/N/E facing slopes. Latent danger of glide-snow avalanches persists. In high starting zones, avalanches can reach medium-to-large size. Avoid zones below glide cracks. During the course of the day, small loose-snow avalanches can be expected on extremely steep sunny slopes below 2000 m.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Weak layers occur esp. in near-surface layers of the snowpack. Due to southerly foehn winds, snowdrifts on shady slopes are often deposited atop soft layers where they are trigger-prone. More deeply embedded weak layers of faceted crystals near crusts are triggerable only in isolated cases. The fresh snowfall from the weekend was moistened on sunny slopes up to 2400 m, on shady slopes it is still loose up to intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: Nighttime skies will be variably cloudy, on the Main Alpine Ridge and in the south mostly heavily overcast. On Tuesday, good visibility, lots of sunshine, only high clouds, in afternoon diffuse light. Main Alpine Ridge and Lungau Nockberge will be in fog at times, light rainfall/snowfall is possible. Southerly winds will be brisk to strong, stormier in the foehn lanes (80 km/hr). At 2000 m: -5 to +6 degrees; at 3000 m: -4 to 0 degrees.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Lots of wind, a little fresh snow: by Wednesday, slightly higher danger.

AvProblem.comment: distant from ridges, in gullies, bowls, behind discontinuities
in extremely steep grass-covered terrain, possible at any time of day or night

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is low. At high altitudes, fresh small snowdrift accumulations are often triggerable by 1 person, esp in gullies and bowls. The danger of falling outweighs that of snow masses. Latent danger of glide-snow avalanches persists. In high starting zones, avalanches can reach medium-to-large size. Avoid zones below glide cracks. During the course of the day, small loose-snow avalanches can be expected on extremely steep sunny slopes due to solar radiation.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Due to southerly foehn winds, snowdrifts on shady slopes are often deposited atop soft layers where they are trigger-prone. The fresh snowfall from the weekend was moistened on sunny slopes up to 2400 m, on shady slopes it is still loose up to intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: Nighttime skies will be variably cloudy. On Tuesday, good visibility, lots of sunshine, only high clouds, in afternoon diffuse light. Southerly winds will be brisk to strong, stormier in the foehn lanes (80 km/hr). At 2000 m: -5 to +6 degrees.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Avalanche danger levels are not expected to change significantly.

AvProblem.comment: distant from ridgelines, thin/small snowdrift masses

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is low. Fresh small snowdrift accumulations are trigger-prone at high altitudes, can often be triggered by 1 person, esp. in steep gullies and bowls. Danger of taking a fall outweighs that of snow masses.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Due to southerly foehn winds, snowdrifts on shady slopes are often deposited atop soft layers where they are trigger-prone. The fresh snowfall from the weekend was moistened on sunny slopes up to 2400 m, on shady slopes it is still loose up to intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: Nighttime skies will be variably cloudy. On Tuesday, good visibility, lots of sunshine, only high clouds, in afternoon diffuse light. Southerly winds will be brisk to strong, stormier in the foehn lanes (80 km/hr). At 2000 m: -5 to +6 degrees; at 3000 m: -4 to 0 degrees.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Avalanche danger levels are not expected to change significantly.
